Package renderer

Class Render

java.lang.Object
renderer.Render
public class Render
extends java.lang.Object
class for Creating the color matrix from the scene for the image.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private ImageWriter _imageWriter
    Object of image Writer for writing the image
    private Scene _scene
    the scene to be Rendered
    private static int MAX_CALC_COLOR_LEVEL
    max level of recursion when calculating reflection and transparency color
    private static double MIN_CALC_COLOR_K
    color that has les weight then this gives very little effect of color and wil not be calculated

    calculates the color of a given geoPoint taking in count all light sources in the scene.

    calculates the color of a given geoPoint taking in count all light sources in the scene and all reflection and transparency colors.

    calculates the diffuse part of the reflection of light.

    finds the point from the list closest to the camera.

    prints a grid on top of the image.
    void renderImage()
    construct Rays from the camera Through every Pixel and calculates the color of that pixel by checking if the ray intersects with any geometries and which is in front ant what is its color.

    checks whether the light from a source hits a given pointor that point is shaded by another object.

    • Render

      public Render​(ImageWriter imageWriter, Scene scene)
      constructor for class Render.
      Parameters:
      imageWriter - instance of image Writer
      scene - the scene

  • Method Details

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage()
      construct Rays from the camera Through every Pixel and calculates the color of that pixel by checking if the ray intersects with any geometries and which is in front ant what is its color.

    • getClosestPoint

      private Intersectable.GeoPoint getClosestPoint​(java.util.List<Intersectable.GeoPoint> points)
      finds the point from the list closest to the camera. calls getClosestPoint(List, Point3D) with camera as p0
      Parameters:
      points - a list of intersection points on the ray
      Returns:
      the closest point to beginning of ray (the camera)

    • getClosestPoint

      private Intersectable.GeoPoint getClosestPoint​(java.util.List<Intersectable.GeoPoint> points, Point3D p0)
      finds the point from the list closest to beginning of the ray.
      Parameters:
      points - a list of intersection points on the ray
      p0 - the head of the ray
      Returns:
      the closest point to beginning of ray (p0)

    • findClosestIntersection

      private Intersectable.GeoPoint findClosestIntersection​(Ray ray)
      finds the closest intersection point between a ray and the geometries in the scene. calls Intersectable.findIntersections(Ray) to get all intersection points and then calls getClosestPoint(List, Point3D) to find the one closest to beginning of the ray
      Parameters:
      ray - the given ray
      Returns:
      closest intersection point or null if there are no intersection points

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint)
      calculates the color of a given geoPoint taking in count all light sources in the scene.
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the given geoPoint
      Returns:
      the color at that geoPoint

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray inRay)
      calculates the color of a given geoPoint taking in count all light sources in the scene and all reflection and transparency colors. calls recursion function calcColor(GeoPoint, Ray, int, double) to add all reflection and transparency colors and adds the ambient Light
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the given geoPoint
      inRay - the ray of light that hits at the given geoPoint
      Returns:
      the color at that geoPoint

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray inRay, int level, double k)
      calculates the color of a given geoPoint taking in count all light sources in the scene and all reflection and transparency colors. calls getLightSourceColor(GeoPoint, Color, Vector, Vector, double, double, int, double) to add all light source effects calls itself with recursion to add all reflection and transparency colors
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the given geoPoint
      inRay - the ray of light that hits at the given geoPoint
      level - level of recursion
      k - the weight of color calculated at this call
      Returns:
      the color at that geoPoint

    • getLightSourceColor

      private Color getLightSourceColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Color color, Vector v, Vector n, double kd, double ks, int nShininess, double k)
      calculates the effect of all light sources at a given point.
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the given geoPoint
      color - color at the given geoPoint
      v - vector from camera to the point
      n - normal vector at the given geoPoint
      kd - diffuse coefficient of the material of geometry
      ks - specular coefficient of the material of geometry
      nShininess - strength of Shininess of the material of geometry
      k - the weight of color calculated at this call
      Returns:
      the color at that geoPoint

    • constructRefractedRay

      private Ray constructRefractedRay​(Point3D point, Ray inRay, Vector n)
      constructs the ray of refracted light.
      Parameters:
      point - the point we ned refracted ray from
      inRay - the ray from source that huts at the point
      n - normal vector from tha geometry at the point
      Returns:
      ray of refracted light

    • constructReflectedRay

      private Ray constructReflectedRay​(Point3D point, Ray inRay, Vector n)
      constructs the ray of reflected light.
      Parameters:
      point - the point we ned reflected ray from
      inRay - the ray from source that huts at the point
      n - normal vector from tha geometry at the point
      Returns:
      ray of reflected light

    • unshaded

      private boolean unshaded​(Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint gp, LightSource lightSource)
      checks whether the light from a source hits a given pointor that point is shaded by another object.
      Parameters:
      l - vector from light source towards the point
      n - normal vector from the geometry at the given point
      gp - the geo point we are checking if is unshaded
      lightSource - the light source we are checking if the light from gets to the point
      Returns:
      boolean value true wen the point is unshaded

    • transparency

      private double transparency​(Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint gp, LightSource lightSource)
      checks whether the light from a source hits a given pointor that point is shaded by another object.
      Parameters:
      l - vector from light source towards the point
      n - normal vector from the geometry at the given point
      gp - the geo point we are checking if is unshaded
      lightSource - the light source we are checking if the light from gets to the point
      Returns:
      boolean value true wen the point is unshaded

    • calcSpecular

      private Color calcSpecular​(double ks, Vector l, Vector n, double nl, Vector v, int nShininess, Color li)
      calculates the specular part of the reflection of light.
      Parameters:
      ks - specular coefficient
      l - vector from light source to the point
      n - normal vector from geometry at the point
      nl - dot product between the 2 vectors
      v - vector from camera to the point
      nShininess - strength of Shininess
      li - the light that hits the geometry at the point
      Returns:
      specular reflection of light

    • calcDiffusive

      private Color calcDiffusive​(double kd, double nl, Color li)
      calculates the diffuse part of the reflection of light.
      Parameters:
      kd - diffuse coefficient
      nl - dot product between vector from light source to the point and normal vector from geometry at the point
      li - the light that hits the geometry at the point
      Returns:
      diffuse reflection of light

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid​(int interval, java.awt.Color color)
      prints a grid on top of the image.
      Parameters:
      interval - the amount of pixels between the grid lines
      color - the color of the grid lines

    • writeToImage

      public void writeToImage()
      writes the pixels to the image file and saves it. calls ImageWriter.writeToImage().
